ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Nonorganic hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Initial testing showed significant PTA-SRT discrepancies (22-23 dB) and inconsistent behaviors, which resolved after reinstruction.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss (bilateral)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Valid post-reinstruction thresholds revealed mild-to-moderately severe (Right) and moderate-to-severe (Left) SNHL, consistent with noise exposure history.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tympanic membrane perforation (Left)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Left tympanometry was flat (Type B) with a large ear canal volume (2.30 cm3), consistent with perforation and history of chronic infections.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient reported constant bilateral ringing, worse in the left ear, causing stress.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing thresholds given reports of hearing loss, tinnitus, and noise exposure.
To evaluate middle ear function given the history of chronic ear infections, pain, and fullness.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial pure-tone testing demonstrated significant functional overlay with PTA-SRT discrepancies of 22-23 dB. Following reinstruction, valid thresholds were obtained showing bilateral sensorineural hearing loss (mild-to-moderately severe in the right ear, moderate-to-severe in the left ear). Tympanometry revealed a normal right middle ear but a left tympanic membrane perforation indicated by a large canal volume.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Significant functional overlay; PTA-SRT differences of 22 dB (Right) and 23 dB (Left); inconsistent responses.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Valid thresholds obtained. Right: mild SNHL sloping to moderately-severe. Left: moderate SNHL sloping to severe. SRTs (R: 40 dB, L: 43 dB) in agreement with PTAs. WRS 100% bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right: Normal (Type A, 1.30 cm3). Left: Flat (Type B) with large canal volume (2.30 cm3), consistent with perforation.

proposed_items: Return for hearing test after medical management
counseling_actions: Discuss the discrepancy between initial and final tests to explain the true hearing levels
Explain the tympanometry results indicating a likely left eardrum perforation
Counsel on hearing protection given noise exposure history
Discuss tinnitus management and stress reduction

escalation.rationale_short: To manage the left tympanic membrane perforation and chronic ear infections.

follow_up_plan.objective: To monitor the stability of hearing thresholds.

expected_outcome: Patient encouraged to follow up with an otologist as scheduled for medical management.
Audiological recommendations established to return for a hearing test after medical management and annually to monitor hearing stability.
